location_name: Vrtbovská zahrada - nejkrásnější barokní zahrada v Praze
location_short_descr: On the slope of Petřín you can visit one of the most beautiful and important baroque gardens in Prague, the...
location_long_descr:
On the slope of Petřín you can visit one of the most beautiful and important baroque gardens in Prague, the Vrtbovská garden. It is even claimed to be one of the most beautiful gardens of its kind north of the Alps.
This terraced Italian-style baroque garden was built for Jan Josef, Count of Vrtba , the highest burgrave of Prague Castle, near the Vrtba Palace in the years 1715 – 1720. The author of the design is František Maxmilián Kaňka. The sculptural decoration of the garden was created by Matyáš Bernard Braun . Václav Vavřinec Reiner also participated in the successful work , from whom you can especially admire the fresco on the vault of the sala terrain.
